column4: Why do i get a update notice about the AMD drivers while i got a intel processor and a nvidia videocard? :/
What update? Are you running 32 or 64 bit?
did you perhaps install xserver-xorg-driver-all?
Oh, actually.  It seems that xserver-xorg might bring in a lot of that stuff depending on how its installed.
How about xserver-xorg-video-all?

http://packages.ubuntu.com/hardy/xserver-xorg see how those depends are set up?  the -all packages (both input and video) depend on every arch it seems.  Depending on what gets chosen when you install, you may find yourself with all of those.
it'd be -nv
Or, nvidia-glx with or without -legacy
See the first two things after -video-2
correct, although the -nv version might not be a bad fallback in case something goes wrong.  But yeah, you just need one of those.
I believe you need the nvidia-settings package for that.
I don't know.  You'll have to ask someone who has experience with it.
What do you want to change? (and you can always look without rebooting, just see /boot/grub/menu.lst)
You can move vista up to before the ## begin automagic debian line, and that'll work.  You'll probably want to change your default to 1 intsead of 0 then (or have vista as default)
There's a "default " line near the top of the file
yeah
The other way to do the defaults is with "default saved" and then savedefault on menu entries
That means your vista option is inside of the ### debian automagic lines, right?
that won't work.  You *cannot* have anything else in between those two lines (it'll get erased)
Not really, no.
You can have it temporarily as the second option, except every time you get a new kernel, you'll need to re-do it.
paste the whole file
You can do that, except the next time you install a kernel update, you'll need to recopy the vista one up to under the ubuntu one.
